Package option

Interface Option<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The object type contained within the Some-variant
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ForwardingOption<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    None, Some
    public interface Option<T>

    A Maybe-type, similar to Java's built-in Optional class. This class provides static instantiation methods for either case, as well as a conversion method from @Optional

    This interface contains 3 abstract methods: unwrap, flatMap, and orElse, and then provides default implementations with respect to these methods.

    Further more, the ForwardingOption interface is provided for easy implementation of wrapper classes.

    Author:
    Lucca Kaasgaard Christiansen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  Option.Action

      Returns the first Option if it is None, otherwise it returns Some

      Tries to extract the inner object, otherwise it throws an exception containing the error message passed to the parameter.
      default Option<T> filter​(Predicate<T> p)
      Returns Some if an object is present and it passes the predicate, otherwise it returns None.
      <R> Option<R> flatMap​(Function<? super T,​? extends Option<R>> func)
      Given a function which takes an instance of type T as input, if the object is Some, this method will return the result of applying that method to the inner object.

      Flattens any nested Options.

      A utility-function to convert a Optional to an instance of this type.

    • Method Detail

      • none

        static <T> None<T> none()
        Instantiate the None-variant of the class.

      • some

        static <T> Some<T> some​(T thing)
        Return the Some-variant containing the object passed to the function.

      • from

        static <T> Option<T> from​(Optional<T> optional)
        A utility-function to convert a Optional to an instance of this type.

      • unwrap

        T unwrap()
        Extraction method to retrive the inner object if present. It is bad practice to call this method unless the client code can guarantee there is an object present.
        Throws:
        UnwrappedNone - on None

      • flatMap

        <R> Option<R> flatMap​(Function<? super T,​? extends Option<R>> func)
        Given a function which takes an instance of type T as input, if the object is Some, this method will return the result of applying that method to the inner object.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The inner type of the new option

      • orElse

        Option<T> orElse​(Supplier<? extends Option<T>> other)
        The None-counterpart to flatMap. Returns the Option returned by the passed function, in case of the None-variant, otherwise the method returns its own instance.

      • stream

        default Stream<T> stream()

      • unwrapOr

        default T unwrapOr​(T defaultValue)
        Tries to extract the inner object if there is one, otherwise returns the default

      • unwrapOrElse

        default T unwrapOrElse​(Supplier<? extends T> defaultFunc)
        Tries to extract the inner object, otherwise it evaluates the passed function and returns the result.

      • expect

        default T expect​(String reason)
        Tries to extract the inner object, otherwise it throws an exception containing the error message passed to the parameter.
        Throws:
        UnwrappedNone - containing the reason.

      • ifSome

        default Option<T> ifSome​(Consumer<? super T> onSome)
        On Some-variants, this method passes the inner object to the passed function. Assuming the consumer has no side effects the mutate the Option, this is a noop, that leaves the Option unaffected.

      • ifNone

        default Option<T> ifNone​(Option.Action onNone)
        Evaluates the Action if the Option is None. The Action is a Functional Interface which takes no arguments and returns no values, so it is assumed to have side effects. Like ifSome, it is a noop, disregarding any side effects from running the action.

      • okOr

        default <E extends Exception> Result<T,​E> okOr​(E error)
        Converts this instance to a Result that is Ok on Some, and an Err containing the passed Exception on None.

      • okOrElse

        default <E extends Exception> Result<T,​E> okOrElse​(Supplier<? extends E> error)
        Converts this object to a Result that is Ok on Some, and an Err containing the result of evaluating the passed function.

      • map

        default <R> Option<R> map​(Function<? super T,​? extends R> func)
        Applies the function to the inner object if present and returns a new Option containing the result.

      • mapOr

        default <R> R mapOr​(R defaultValue,
                    Function<? super T,​? extends R> func)
        Applies the function to the inner object if present and returns the result, otherwise it returns the default value.

      • mapOrElse

        default <R> R mapOrElse​(Supplier<? extends R> defaultFunc,
                        Function<? super T,​? extends R> presentFunc)
        Applies the function to the inner object if present and returns it, otherwise it returns the result of evaluating the default function.

      • isSome

        default boolean isSome()
        Returns true on Some and false on None

      • isSomeAnd

        default boolean isSomeAnd​(Predicate<? super T> p)
        Returns true on Some if the inner object passes the predicate.

      • isNone

        default boolean isNone()
        Returns true on None and false on Some

      • or

        default Option<T> or​(Option<T> other)
        Returns the first option if it is Some, and the second Option, if the first is None.

      • contains

        default boolean contains​(T candidate)

      • and

        default <R> Option<R> and​(Option<R> other)
        Returns the first Option if it is None, otherwise it returns Some

      • andThen

        default <R> Option<R> andThen​(Function<? super T,​? extends Option<R>> func)
        Alias for flatMap

      • filter

        default Option<T> filter​(Predicate<T> p)
        Returns Some if an object is present and it passes the predicate, otherwise it returns None.

      • xor

        default Option<T> xor​(Option<T> other)
        If only one Option is Some, it returns Some, otherwise it returns None.

      • flatten

        default <R> Option<R> flatten()
        Flattens any nested Options. Thus, in case you have a structure such as Option<Option<Option<T>>> this returns an Option<T>

      • matches

        default <R> R matches​(Function<? super T,​? extends R> some,
                      Supplier<? extends R> none)
        Applies the some-function on the inner object if it is present, otherwise it evaluates the none-function.

      • orCollector

        static <T> Collector<Option<T>,​List<T>,​Option<List<T>>> orCollector()
        This collector takes a List<Option<T>> and converts it to an Option<List<T>>, If any objects are present, this returns a Some with a List containing all objects, otherwise it returns None

      • andCollector

        static <T> Collector<Option<T>,​List<Option<T>>,​Option<List<T>>> andCollector()
        This collector converts a List<Option<T>> into an Option<List<T>>. This collector returns Some if, and only if, all Options in the List are Some, otherwise it returns None.
